description.narrative: Output 1: light infrastructure rehabilitated. Output 2: Immediate capacity of municipalities boosted. Output 3: Local conflict analysis, facilitation and mediation strengthened.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
O. 1 - Number of municipal needs assessments conducted - Number of light infrastructure rehabilitated - Number of equipment provided - Number of critical businesses rehabilitated
O. 2 - Number of capacity assessments - Number of technical experts deployed - Number of local authorities with increased capacity O. 3 - Number of local assessments conducted - Number of civic engagement campaigns - Number of youth and women engaged - Number of municipalities trained and engaged in conflict resolution efforts

comment.narrative:
Output 1: Light infrastructure destroyed by conflict rehabilitated and recovery of critical businesses supported Key infrastructure destroyed in the intensified conflict since mid-2014 disrupting the regular functioning of hospitals, schools, roads, electricity networks, power grids, police stations, and water facilities - Local businesses (MSMEs) impacted by the crisis. - Lack of viable economic opportunities for jobs and income generation for youth, including vulnerable groups (IDPs, returnees, and migrants).
Output 2: Immediate capacity boost to municipalities provided - Municipalities lack human resource and financial capacity to effective function in their role as local authorities. - Traditional and weak bureaucratic systems in local institutions (municipalities and executive bodies) - Current partnership building between local actors is ad hoc, externally driven, unstructured and reactive. - Inadequate levels of financial transparency. - Limited engagement with civil society and media. - Marked decrease in access to and quality of basic services in certain areas and even more so for the 700,000 persons of concern (IDPs, refugees, migrants).
Output 3: Local conflict analysis, facilitation and mediation capacity strengthened - Role of municipalities in mediation and conflict resolution remains ad hoc. - Traditional leaders and structures play an important role in local mediation and conflict mitigation, but these efforts mainly act as mitigation of escalation following an incident, rather than as an effective peacebuilding mechanism. - Existing conflict management and dialogue efforts at local level are not sufficiently visible, remain ad hoc and reactive rather than preventative. - Level of violent criminality and threats against private property increasing across the country. - Protective system for women against violence is weak, due to institutional and cultural barriers.
# of municipalities with rehabilitated and equipped public services
13 municipalities with rehabilitated and equipped public services
# of municipalities with rehabilitated and equipped public services

Output 1 1- 27 schools, 1 university library and cafeteria rehabilitated in Benghazi, Sebha, Sirt, Tawergha, Tripoli, and Ubari 2- 12.5 km solar streetlights installation installed in Tawergha, and Ubari. 3- 2 Hospitals, 3 Clinics rehabilitated in Sebha, Sirt, Tripoli. 4- 65 Lots of Medical Equipment, 5 Ambulances provided to BDerna, Sebha, and Tripoli 5- Public infrastructures (cultural house, computer lab, youth social centre) implemented in Benghazi, Tawergha, and Ubari. 6- 4 firetrucks, 1 PPE lot, 1 lifting crane, computer lab equipment provided to Derna, Ghat, Kufra, Tawergha. 7- 28 Refuse Collectors, and 7 Tractor Heads provided to Tripoli (Abu Salim, Ein Zara, Souq Al-Gomma, Tajoura, Central Tripoli, Hay Al-Andaloues, Ben Gashir). 8- 21 Water Pumps, 4 Water Tankers, 47 Sewage Pumps, 7 Sewage Suction Trucks, 7 Pesticide Sprayer Vehicles, 25 Generators provided to Benghazi, Derna, Ghat, and Sebha. 9- Testing kits, testing machines, reagents provided to Tripoli to support COVID 19 response.
Output 2 1- One local development plan for Kikla was produced through UNDP technical support. The plan was endorsed by the local authority and central ministry of planning.
Output 3 1- Two community consultation were conducted for two municipalities (Derna and Tawergha). Consequently, stabilization goals were identified by the local actors and investment plans were generated.
# of municipalities with rehabilitated and equipped public services # of local development plans drafted # of local NGOs supported through capacity building programmes

Output 1 1- eight schools rehabilitated in Derna, Sebha, Sirte and Tripoli benefiting 3900 students. 2- 13.3 km solar streetlights installed in Benghazi, Kufra and Tawergha benefiting 900,000 population. 3- 5 Hospitals, 4 Clinics rehabilitated in Bani Walid, Benghazi, Sebha benefiting the entire targeted municipalities and the neighboring ones as well 4- 1 Vaccine refrigeration, 1 Incinerator installed in Derna and Sirte. 5- Public infrastructures (2 libraries, 1 coast guard building, 1 main entrance roundabout) in Benghazi, Sebha, Sirt, and Ubari benefiting 1.7 population 6- 2 garbage trucks provided to Ajdabya and 2 garbage trucks provided to Derna. 7- 1 suction truck, 4 water pumps, 2 pesticide sprayers, 4 folding hydraulic cranes, and 10 water pumps provided in Bani Walid, Derna, Misurata, Tawergha, Ghat benefiting 800,000 population. 8- Two rubble removal projects implemented for three war affected municipalities; two in Tripoli and one in Tawergha. 9- 2 Oxygen plant installation, 2 isolation centres, 1 hybrid solar power installation provided in Benghazi, Bent Baya, Kufra, and Tripoli benefiting the entire population in the above mentioned locations for COVID 19 response. 10- 5 ambulances, 42 ventilators, and PPEs for COVID 19 response provided for Ajdabiya, Bent Baya, Ghat, Sebha, and Tripoli benefiting the entire population in the above mentioned locations for COVID 19 response.
Output 2 1- Three municipalities (Derna, Bani Walid, and Ghat) have received technical support to initiate and draft local development plans and resources mobilization strategy.
Output 3
1- 33 Local NGOs received capacity building support on conflict analysis, project management, and organizational development to enable them in taking lead on conflict resolution/reduction at the local level.
